CHILDLIKE.Definition: (of adults) showing the good qualities that children have, such as trusting people, being honest and enthusiastic

CURIOSITY.Definition: an eager wish to know or learn about something

CATCH US OFF GUARD.Definition: to surprise someone by doing something that they are not expecting or ready for

SUSPECT.Definition: to think or believe something to be true or probable

IGNORANT.Definition: not having enough knowledge, understanding, or information about something

ALONG THE LINE.Definition: during a process or series of events : at some point in the past

INTENTION.Definition: something that you want and plan to do

ARROGANT.Definition: unpleasantly proud and behaving as if you are more important than, or know more than, other people

HEAR PEOPLE OUT.Definition: to listen to someone until that person has said everything they want to say

CUTS THEM OFF.Definition: to suddenly interrupt someone who is speaking

STROKES HIS OWN EGO.Definition: to say nice things to someone to make them feel good, especially because you want something from them

MASTURBATE.Definition: to touch or rub your sexual organs in order to give yourself sexual pleasure

STROKE.Definition: an act of moving your hand, another part of the body, or an object gently over something or someone, usually repeatedly and for pleasure

AT FACE VALUE.Definition: as true or genuine without being questioned or doubted

INSIGHTS.Definition: (the ability to have) a clear, deep, and sometimes sudden understanding of a complicated problem or situation

COMPELS.Definition: to produce a strong feeling or reaction

VAGUE.Definition: not clearly expressed, known, described, or decided

OVERLOOKED.Definition: to fail to notice or consider something or someone

COMPREHENSION.Definition: the ability to understand completely and be familiar with a situation, facts, etc.

ENVISION.Definition: to imagine or expect something to happen, appear, etc. in a particular way

DESPICABLE.Definition: very unpleasant or bad, causing strong feelings of dislike

COMPLEMENT.Definition: to help make something or someone more complete or effective

DEPLOY.Definition: to use something or someone, especially in an effective way

DRAMATIC.Definition: talking or behaving in a way that makes something seem much worse, more serious, more frightening, etc. than it really is

ATTENTIVELY.Definition: in a way that is attentive (= listening carefully or giving careful attention)

MUNDANE.Definition: very ordinary and therefore not interesting

EXTENSIVE.Definition: wide in range and including much detailed information

RODEO.Definition: a public performance or competition in which cowboys (= people who take care of cattle) show their skill at riding cattle and wild horses and at catching cattle with ropes

INTERRUPTING.Definition: to stop a person from speaking for a short period by something you say or do

COURTESY.Definition: polite behavior, or a polite action or remark

RECIPROCATED.Definition: to share the same feelings as someone else, or to behave in the same way as someone else

SINGLE-MINDED.Definition: only doing things that relate to one activity or interest

SIMPLIFY.Definition: to make something less complicated and therefore easier to do or understand

BOIL THEM DOWN.Definition: to reduce information, usually so that it contains only its most important parts

TAILOR.Definition: to adjust something to suit a particular need or situation

ANALOGIES.Definition: a comparison between things that have similar features, often used to help explain a principle or idea

PROFICIENT.Definition: very skilled and experienced at something

PARALLELS.Definition: something very similar to something else, or a similarity between two things

EMULATE.Definition: to copy something achieved by someone else and try to do it as well as they have

REFINE.Definition: to improve an idea, method, system, etc. by making small changes

PAY HUGE DIVIDENDS.Definition: if something you do pays dividends, it causes good results at a time in the future

THEORETICALLY.Definition: used to say what is possible, although it may not actually happen

COMFORT ZONE.Definition: a situation in which you feel comfortable and in which your ability and determination are not being tested

INTROVERT.Definition: someone who is shy, quiet, and prefers to spend time alone rather than often being with other people

ANTISOCIAL.Definition: often avoiding spending time with other people

EXTROVERTED.Definition: an energetic person who enjoys being with other people

ALIKE.Definition: used after referring to two groups of people or things to show that both groups are included

IMPROVISING.Definition: to invent or provide something at the time when it is needed without having already planned it

ADAPT.Definition: to change your ideas or behavior to make them suitable for a new situation
